snippet: Levi Aron, a supply store clerk accused of kidnapping and dismembering Leiby Kletzky, is expected to make a deal with prosecutors and face 40 years in prison.
abstract: Levi Aron, accused of kidnapping, killing and dismembering 8-year-old Leiby Kletzky in the Hasidic neighborhood of Borough Park, Brooklyn, in 2010, is expected to plead guilty; Aron faces at least 40 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: Levi Aron, a supply store clerk accused of kidnapping and dismembering Leiby Kletzky, is expected to make a deal with prosecutors and face 40 years in prison.

headline.seo: Levi Aron Expected to Plead Guilty to Killing Leiby Kletzky
headline.main: Guilty Plea Is Expected in the Killing of Brooklyn Boy, 8
headline.print_headline: Guilty Plea and 40-Year Term Expected in Killing of Boy, 8
